Kyle Harms.name: Kyle Harms
Kyle Harms.about: At Washington University in St. Louis, Kyle pursued his interest in HCI and computing education as a member of the Looking Glass Research Group. His research focused on leveraging learning theories to improve novices' ability to learning computer programming independently.

Chris Csíkszentmihályi.name: Chris Csíkszentmihályi
Chris Csíkszentmihályi.focus: Information for Accountability, Social & Environmental Justice, and Activism
Chris Csíkszentmihályi.about: Csíkszentmihályi has been notably founding and directing the MIT Center for Future Civic Media (C4), dedicated to developing technologies that strengthen communities, and also the MIT Media Lab's Computing Culture group, creating unique media technologies for cultural and political applications.

Gilly Leshed.name: Gilly Leshed
Gilly Leshed.focus: Human computer interaction, Computer-Supported Cooperative Work
Gilly Leshed.about: Dr. Leshed received her PhD at Cornell in Information Science in 2009. She also worked several years in the industry as an HCI expert for commercial flight-deck avionics system and command and control systems for military purposes.
